page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO PORLOCK
page.content: The busy town of{Porlock(Pop.1231)} situated in the N.W. of this block caters for the everyday needs of the {residents}and in summer for thousands of{tourists.}Varied holiday accomodation,cafes and souvenir shops abound.Half the rest of the block is covered by{heather moorland}and {ancient oak woodlands}cut by fats running streams.The remainder is{rich} {farmland. Selworthy}and{Luccombe}are small attractive villages with thatched cottages and cob walls,plus large church.{Horner}and{West}Luccombe are picturesque hamlets each with a {packhorse bridge.}The hills are cut by narrow often steep roads;the moorland and woods provide excellent riding and walking country.The area is within the {Exmoor National Park}and much is owned by the{National Trust.}
